intro: Tripogandra cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf tripogandra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or marshy areas. The botanical features of Tripogandra cordifolia make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical study.
